keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up'.
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle outside the airport.

He faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Cagle, who lives in Cartersville, Georgia, was previously convicted of marijuana possession over two decades ago.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, highlighting the seriousness of the incident.

Atlanta’s Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport is the world’s busiest airport, with over 108 million passengers in 2024, making the event particularly significant due to the scale and vulnerability of the location.
The incident was averted due to early intervention by Cagle’s family, who alerted Cartersville police, who then notified Atlanta Police.
Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens noted that Cagle’s mental health and possession of a firearm created a dangerous combination.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem expressed gratitude that no one was harmed, underscoring national implications and inter-agency coordination.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, the world’s busiest airport, after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up'. Though not armed at the time of arrest, police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle, a former marijuana possession offender, faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assaults, and unlawful firearm possession. Authorities credit the timely alert from his family and coordinated action between Cartersville and Atlanta police for averted tragedy. The FBI is assisting in the investigation. The incident underscores the importance of mental health awareness, airport security, and community vigilance in preventing mass threats at high-traffic travel hubs.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to ‘Shoot It Up’
